info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:33PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
At 332 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Florence, moving east at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Florence, Pamplico, Quinby, Hyman, Effingham, Mars Bluff, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, Francis Marion University, Claussen, Evergreen, Carolinas Hospital System, Mcleod Regional Medical Center, Carolinas Hospital System - Cedar Tower, and Health South Rehabilitation Hospital.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 140 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 153 and 166, and between mile markers 168 and 169.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature's leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN FLORENCE COUNTY THROUGH 400 PM EDT
